reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not A Fan of Sci-Fi Books in General...But Enjoyed This One
reviews.reviewText: Though I am not really a fan of Sci-Fi books, but I enjoyed the non Sci- Fi volumes by the author, J. Clifton Slater :"Clay Warrior Stories". Thus I decided to try out his Sci-Fi volumes. I purchased the first three available volumes; which I enjoyed so much that I immediately purchased the fourth in the series that is, "On Point", when it became available, also enjoyable.Furthermore, I have checked Amazon to Pre-order the latest Volume of the :"Clay Warrior Stories", that is "Reluctant Siege", but this not yet available for pre-order.I hope this time Amazon does not release first on Kindle before releasing it on Hardcover/Paperback. I am one of those that is not a fanof e-books. I want something I can hold and flip the pages.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent read with forgivable errors
reviews.reviewText: Great story, pacing, and characters but a few grammatical errors that could have been helped with a bit more editing. Overall a very easy and enjoyable read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The author has created a new universe and new protagonist. Great storyline and characters. Lots of action in the different aspects of the protagonists life. Enjoyed it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I grabbed this series after reading the author’s Clay legionary series and this one might be even better. Can’t wait to read the rest

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This was a fantastic read. Being a retired military man I could identify with the main character and the interactions with his assigned duties. Great book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Recommend, but the grammar is flawed
reviews.reviewText: it's an interesting story. The pace is quick.. The character of ensign piran is engaging. I will definitely buy the next installment.The only problem is that the book is full of grammatical errors , i wish the author would submit the book to a serious editor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars On Station - An Entertaining, Futuristic Space & Military Adventure
reviews.reviewText: On Station - Galactic Council Realm by J. Clifton Slater was a quick read that had me turning pages to find out what happened next. I enjoyed following along as the main character, J-POP, traveled through space overcoming military intrigue, personal challenges and freakishly large space spiders.I also found myself delighted by the space cats and look forward to J-POP's new adventures in On Duty: Galactic Council Realm (Volume 2) .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Grammar, spelling, logic sub par
reviews.reviewText: I hate to ding someone who has gone to the effort to write a book, something I've never done, but this felt like a first novel that hadn't been edited, either for grammar, spelling or logic. I won't go into great detail - there's really no point since the author has already completed the four book story arc and so my comments will have no impact on the quality of the rest of the series.I will say, though, that I finished the book and purchased the next in the series (On Duty) because I saw some promise and wanted to see where things went. Where they went is much of the same, except even more shoddy work. I had to put it down in frustration and walk away. Normally, follow up books are better, at least from the mechanics of the writing, but that wasn't the case here.I can't recommend either this book, On Station, or the follow up book, On Duty, which I give two stars since it seems the author didn't get any better with practice.
Phelan is dropped into an ever building political/war situation once ha completed his pilot training. Fortunately for him, he has old Marine corps skills and childhood training to rely on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 27, 2016
reviews.reviewText: When I was younger I read a lot of Sci-Fi but in recent years I haven’t. ‘On Station’ the first book in J. Clifton Slater’s Galactic Council Realm series must be the first book in the genre that I’ve read for about 20 years. As I got into the book I realised what I had been missing. ‘On Station is a top-class space adventure, which gripped me from page one to the last and I didn’t want to put the book down.J. Clifton Slater has created a detailed and fascinating universe in which the Galactic Council Realm resides. The characters are interesting, especially the hero Sergeant Phelan Oscar Piran, formerly of the Galactic Council Marine Corps. The book was so good that I will certainly be getting the next two in the series and look forward to continuing to follow Phelan’s adventures. Great Sci-Fi and well deserving the five stars I am going to give this review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 10, 2016
reviews.reviewText: This book came recommended by a friend. It's not my normal genre, but it held my interest from first to last. The characters were intriguing, the story well thought out, and filled with enough original ideas to grip a reader who isn't usually drawn into military SciFi.It'll be fascinating to see where the author takes us in the sequel.
